intro: Achyrospermum oblongifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to dry, sandy soils and full sun exposure. It is often found in disturbed areas and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flowers.
